uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.anylogic

Class RandomWithSeedAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • uk.ac.soton.simulation.jsit.anylogic.RandomWithSeedAccess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RandomWithSeedAccess
extends java.util.Random
implements java.io.Serializable
    Random subclass that keeps a copy of the seed so that it is accessible (and so can be written out to promote experiment reproducibility), and allocates sequential seeds for each instantiation (as AnyLogic does internally for multi-run experiments). This class has to be specified in the experiment's Randomness section.

    AnyLogic does strange things internally. When giving a seed S in the experiment:

    • single run experiments: creates one Engine instance but with 2 RNGs (presumably one for the Experiment). Run gets seed S+1
    • N-run multi-run non-parallel experiments: creates one Engine instance but with N+1 RNGs (yet only N calls to the 2-parameter constructor show up, so presumably 1 is using the 1-parameter one unlike in the single run case!). Runs get seeds S+1, S+2, ...
    • N-run multi-run parallel experiments: creates one Engine instance with C (num cores) RNGs, and one separate Engine instance (even if there are <C runs). Runs get seeds S+C+1, S+C+2, ...
    (Use the two-parameter constructor in your experiments to see this.)
    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    Stuart Rossiter
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Testing version of the constructor: call with an Engine instance (getEngine() in an Experiment or Agent) to see the different Engine instances RNGs are assigned to
      RandomWithSeedAccess(long seed)
      With seed constructor, as called by AnyLogic code when a seed is used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomWithSeedAccess

        public RandomWithSeedAccess()
        Default constructor (where we want a 'random' seed)

      • RandomWithSeedAccess

        public RandomWithSeedAccess(long seed)
        With seed constructor, as called by AnyLogic code when a seed is used. For multi-run experiments, runs after the first use seeds that are increments of the initial one (the argument to this constructor).
